sub_title: Science and Medical Writer, Editor | Analytical and reflective | Award-winning presenter | Science, strategy, and prose
summary:
I love to explain things normally deemed too complicated to communicate.

Medical writer and editor with over a decade of experience specializing in molecular medicine: a fancy phrase for my joyful witness of cell biology and biochemistry applied to therapy areas such as oncology and rare disease (including genetic and post-infectious conditions). In medicine, as in medical communications, the small impacts the big.

I've worked with audiences from preschoolers to PIs to cover pivotal research—from basic science to phase IV clinical trials. Biomarkers. Targeted therapy. Clinical guidelines. I'm a professional nerd. 

Every job I've ever had has involved explaining science. A researcher to be a part of it, and before that a teacher bubbling over about it. Technical experience in hospital pathology and biochemistry research. Recruited to the leading healthcare communications agency in Asia. I can't help but share what scientists are doing to combat disease, now.

Because science is beautiful, and I appreciate when it is described excellently.


► "Agile, considerate, and supportive," "proactiveness and dedication ... out-of-the-box thinking and energy," "marvelous working with"—MIMS
► “Analytical, reflective and compassionate nature,” "maturity, independence, and flexibility,” "a rigorous teaching practice characterised by clarity and enthusiasm,“ “well-planned and creative”—Melbourne Graduate School of Education
► "Persuasive and outspoken in communicating her scientific ideas ... passionate about her work ... clearly has the talent and desire to succeed."—The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology
► "Highly intelligent, hardworking … extending her analysis of results beyond what would be expected”—Illawarra Health and Medical Research Institute
► International BSc (Honours), MTeach (Secondary), MPhil (Life Science) | First class


I'm good with copywriting, KOL interviews, layout checks, and getting small things right. You'll get enthusiasm, reliability, research, attention to detail, streamlining. 

My superpower seems to be subject lines; doctors tend to open what I send them.

► Digital deliverables; advisory boards; congress coverage
► Writing and copyediting for scientific journals and their magazines, biotech companies and their blogs
► Contract research for philanthropic societies


Fave authors: Tolstoy, Okri, Woolf, Sebald

And, yes, you can reach out for freelance writing and editing.
LinkedIn DM or renaecrossing@gmail.com
Like molecules, we can start small.

contributors.headline: Science and Medical Writer, Editor | Analytical and reflective | Award-winning presenter | Science, strategy, and prose

projects.title: Engineers Without Borders
projects.description:
Teamwork | Communication | Presentation

My team of 4 researched the needs of families living on the Tonle Sap in Cambodia. We designed and built a floating vegetable garden using aquaponics, to combat malnutrition and provide a source of income. (How does aquaponics work? We had tanks on the side of the garden with fish; the fish would poo in the water and a pump transported the water to the top of the garden to flow through and fertilise the plants.) We presented our work to judges and gave public demonstrations, being awarded 'Best Technical Solution'.

authors.headline: Science and Medical Writer, Editor | Analytical and reflective | Award-winning presenter | Science, strategy, and prose

profile_positions.description:
Therapy areas include: oncology; rare disease and hematology; infectious disease and vaccines; cardiovascular, renal and metabolic disease; immunology and dermatology; neurology/ CNS; medical devices and diagnostics

Based in the Netherlands and working globally
profile_positions.title: Editorial Services

profile_positions.description:
KOL engagement | Client liaison | Lead medical writer for projects and events

"Empowering healthcare communities to improve patient outcomes" is what we do at MIMS.
Where possible, I do that with puns.

I love working in an agency environment – collaborating with clients, project managers, designers, and event managers.

I took initiative to share accessibility resources and research trends with our scientific directors and the wider editorial team. Ask me about my email open rates.

Projects: articles, electronic direct mail, symposium highlights, slide decks, patient websites, manuscript briefs, meeting reports, detail aids – from kickoff to evaluation, with Veeva experience

Events: medical advisory board meetings, expert panels, workshops and multilingual webinars – on site and online
profile_positions.title: Medical Writer, MedComms

company.name: American Society for Biochemistry and Molecular Biology (ASBMB)

profile_positions.company: American Society for Biochemistry and Molecular Biology (ASBMB)
profile_positions.description:
Interviews with scientists | Writing features and journal news | Explaining complex research

In Memoriam, Annual Meeting, BMB in Africa, Wellness, Observance, Awards

I write about new and established science and the people who carry it out. With a background in biochemistry, cell biology and microbiology research, and after teaching chemistry and biology for many years, and with a desire to write since I was school-aged, I'm bursting at the seams. I want to write well and share science with people I care about, causing people to see familiar topics in new ways or come across interesting science that they didn't know existed before.
profile_positions.title: Contributing Writer

profile_positions.description:
Patient websites | Genomics blogs | Manuscript copyediting

Besides contributing to the ASBMB I've provided writing, editing, research and copyediting services to Clear Water Science Consulting, BGI and Oxford University Press, the Hong Kong Genome Institute and the LUI Che Woo Prize. Drop me a line if you would like to read my samples or have a project in mind.

As a freelance science and medical writer I can write original content; write and edit material for publications, websites, slide decks, blogs, newsletters, and proposals; draft graphical abstracts; create animations of scientific phenomena in PowerPoint; interview scientists.
profile_positions.title: Science and Medical Writer

company.name: Lui Che Woo Prize for World Civilisation

profile_positions.company: Lui Che Woo Prize for World Civilisation
profile_positions.description:
Research summaries | Report writing for judging panels | Fact checking

Researched the life and work of nominees in science, the environment, global health and sustainable development, explaining their contributions in reports for an interdisciplinary panel of judges. Nominees were individuals and organizations. It was very fulfiling work.

My favourite part of the role was gaining insight into the systems leaders use to embed their vision. My second-favourite part was team meetings, where we solved problems together and shared appreciation for nominees' varied achievements.
profile_positions.title: Researcher and Report Writer

company.name: The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology

profile_positions.company: The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology
profile_positions.description:
Cell-based assays | Fluorescence microscopy | Champion and People's Choice: Three Minute Thesis

Earning this degree was one of my proudest achievements. I had returned to scientific research after a couple of years of investigating, often through review articles, the area of cell biology that most fascinated me (the answer was motor proteins)! I narrowed my search for research positions, found a brilliant and kind professor with a project about which I was excited, and went from there.

Research summary for a general audience: https://vimeo.com/540599899

Techniques included: cell culture, molecular cloning, Western blot, microtubule regrowth assays, some experience with protein purification

Graduate Teaching Assistant for LIFS3110 Biotechnological Application of Recombinant DNA Techniques (formal student evaluations rated my instruction as 94% mean)

Plotted relationships in R programming language
Reviewed and edited scientific manuscripts and presentations

profile_positions.description:
Course writing and delivery | Public engagement | Interaction with philanthroprists

Wrote a course on my research for secondary school students: I used microtubules and the proteins that 'walk' on them (motor proteins) to introduce cell division, cancer, viruses, and Alzheimer's Disease
Delivered the 8-week course to students from a disadvantaged local school
Invited to share stories with funders at a public meeting

Leadership | Storytelling (1 talk, 1 point) | Interpersonal skills

One-to-one helper for a child with physical/ intellectual disabilities

Volunteering | Teamwork | Community

Lead singer of a multicultural band once a month for congregations of 100+ people

Outreach | Adaptability | Fun

I visited a local preschool as part of their 'Ocean' unit and led students in their first ever science experiment. We had props: water, oil, spoons and cotton buds. Students were quickly captivated (read: distracted) by the bright blue food colouring.
